Class Operations

java.lang.Object
  Operations

public class Operations
extends Object

This class contains all the operations on polynomials for this program.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Cody Moffitt

Constructor Detail

Operations

public Operations()
Method Detail

fft

public static Complex[] fft(int n,
                            Complex[] terms)
Static method to naively evaluate a polynomial at all its nth roots of unity using Fast Fourier Transform. This one calls the actual method, giving it the right parameters, and error checking. The polynomial must have a number of terms that is a power of 2. This function is recursive

Parameters:
n - The n to get the nth roots of unity of, also the number of coefficient terms
terms - An array of Complex numbers with all of the polynomial to evaulate's terms
Returns:
The result of the evaluations as an array of Complex numbers

fftStart

public static Complex[] fftStart(Polynomial poly)
Static method to evaluate a polynomial at all its nth roots of unity using Fast Fourier Transform. This one calls the actual method, giving it the right parameters, and error checking. The polynomial must have a number of terms that is a power of 2.

Parameters:
poly - The polynomial to evaluate
Returns:
The result of the evaluations as an array of Complex numbers

hornersEvaluation

public static Complex hornersEvaluation(Complex eval,
                                        Polynomial poly)
Static method to evaluate a polynomial with a certain x(eval). Uses Horner's algorithm.

Parameters:
eval - Complex number to use for x in the polynomial
poly - The polynomial to evaluate
Returns:
The result of evaluation as a complex number

measureTimeOfAlg

public static long measureTimeOfAlg(int alg,
                                    int nForRoots)
Method to measure time and number of multiplications for a certain algorithm. Evaluates random polynomials at all nth roots of unity. Does not print info to screen.

Parameters:
alg - The algorith to use. 1 is naive, 2 is naive by squaring, 3 is Horner's, 4 is FFT
nForRoots - The n to use when getting the nth roots of unity
Returns:
The amount of time it took the algorithm to execute in nanoseconds

measureTimeOfAlgPrint

public static long measureTimeOfAlgPrint(int alg,
                                         Polynomial poly)
Method to print the amount of time, results, and number of Complex number multiplications for a given algorithm and polynomial.

Parameters:
alg - The algorith to use. 1 is naive, 2 is naive by squaring, 3 is Horner's, 4 is FFT
poly - The polynomial to evaluate
Returns:
The amount of time it took the algorithm to execute in nanoseconds

naiveEvaluation

public static Complex naiveEvaluation(Complex eval,
                                      Polynomial poly)
Static method to naively evaluate a polynomial with a certain x(eval)

Parameters:
eval - Complex number to use for x in the polynomial
poly - The polynomial to evaluate
Returns:
The result of evaluation as a complex number

naiveEvaluationBySquares

public static Complex naiveEvaluationBySquares(Complex eval,
                                               Polynomial poly)
Static method to naively evaluate a polynomial with a certain x(eval). Uses exponentiation by squaring

Parameters:
eval - Complex number to use for x in the polynomial
poly - The polynomial to evaluate
Returns:
The result of evaluation as a complex number

pow

public static Complex pow(Complex a,
                          int toDegree)
Static method to get the value of a complex number if raised to a power

Parameters:
a - The complex number
toDegree - The degree to raise it to
Returns:
a^(toDegree)

powBySquares

public static Complex powBySquares(Complex a,
                                   int toDegree)
Static method to get the value of a complex number if raised to a power. Uses exponentiation by squares.

Parameters:
a - The complex number
toDegree - The degree to raise it to
Returns:
a^(toDegree)

rootsOfUnity

public static Complex[] rootsOfUnity(int n)
Static method to get the nth roots of unity for a certain n

Parameters:
n - The n to get the nth roots of unity of
Returns:
results An array of Complex numbers, with all the nth roots of unity for that n
